title: What is Padel? Presented by USPTA
notes: Concise overview of padel's history and basic concepts by the United States Professional Tennis Association. Great introduction for tennis players transitioning to padel.

sections.title: Comparison to Tennis
sections.description: Introduces padel and compares it to tennis, explaining court dimensions (roughly 33 by 66 feet, about a third the size of a tennis court) and noting that it uses the same scoring system as tennis.

sections.title: Basic Rules and Gameplay
sections.description: Explains fundamental rules including underhand serving, ball bounce requirements, and the ability to play off walls and sides. Emphasizes that 99% of play is doubles.

sections.title: Skill Development and Accessibility
sections.description: Describes padel as a 'thinking person's sport' that is 'easy to learn and hard to master,' making it accessible for players of various skill levels to enjoy immediately.

sections.title: Global Reach and Federation
sections.description: Provides statistics about padel's global presence, noting it's played in 78 countries with 30,000 courts worldwide and 35 different international federations. Concludes with information about USPTA certification.
